results.description: Catalans Dragons sign winger Tom Davies from Wigan Warriors on two-year contract.
results.shortTitle: Catalans sign Wigan winger Davies
results.title: Tom Davies: Catalans Dragons sign winger from Wigan Warriors

results.description: The opening round of 2020 Super League fixtures includes a repeat of the 2019 Grand Final between St Helens and Salford.
results.shortTitle: Saints start 2020 season against Salford
results.title: Super League 2020 fixtures: St Helens start v Salford, Toronto open v Castleford

thumbnail.altText: St Helens lift the Super League Grand Final trophy

results.description: Super League Grand Finalists St Helens and Salford will meet again when Magic Weekend returns to Newcastle in May 2020.
results.shortTitle: Grand Final repeat on Magic Weekend
results.title: Magic Weekend: St Helens and Salford to meet in Grand Final repeat

results.description: Catalans Dragons re-sign half-back Josh Drinkwater on a two-year deal following his departure from Hull KR.
results.shortTitle: Catalans re-sign half-back Drinkwater
results.title: Josh Drinkwater: Catalans re-sign former London Broncos, Leigh & Hull KR half-back

results.description: Catalans Dragons and Warrington Wolves are fined following clashes between fans at their Super League match in August.
results.shortTitle: Catalans & Wire fined for fans misconduct
results.title: Catalans Dragons & Warrington Wolves fined after crowd clashes in Perpignan

results.description: Ex-England coach Steve McNamara signs a new deal with Catalans Dragons, which runs until the end of the 2022 season.
results.shortTitle: McNamara extends Catalans contract
results.title: Steve McNamara: Catalans Dragons' ex-England coach signs new contract until 2022

results.description: Ex-Wigan and Hull KR second-row Joel Tomkins follows brother Sam to Catalans Dragons by signing a two-year deal in Perpignan.
results.shortTitle: Joel Tomkins joins brother Sam at Catalans
results.title: Joel Tomkins: Catalans sign ex-Hull KR and Wigan second-row on two-year deal

results.description: Catalans Dragons prop Antoni Maria signs a new one-year contract with the Super League club.
results.shortTitle: Catalans prop Maria signs new contract
results.title: Antoni Maria: Catalans Dragons prop signs new one-year contract in Perpignan

thumbnail.altText: Antoni Maria was loaned out to Hull KR in 2019, during which time he played in the Robins' narrow 22-20 Magic Weekend win over Salford at Anfield

results.description: Catalans Dragons centre Arthur Romano signs a new one-year contract with the Super League club.
results.shortTitle: Catalans Dragons' Romano signs new deal
results.title: Arthur Romano: Catalans Dragons centre signs new deal

thumbnail.altText: Arthur Romano playing for Catalans Dragons

results.description: Huddersfield Giants sign back-row forward Kenny Edwards from fellow Super League side Catalans Dragons on a three-year contract.
results.shortTitle: Giants sign Catalans forward Edwards
results.title: Kenny Edwards: Huddersfield Giants sign Catalans Dragons forward

thumbnail.altText: Kenny Edwards in action for Catalans Dragons

results.description: Catalans Dragons do not have plans to play at the Nou Camp again but ask Super League to take the Magic Weekend to France.
results.shortTitle: Catalans ask for French Magic Weekend
results.title: Catalans Dragons ask for Magic Weekend to be staged in France

thumbnail.altText: Sam Kasiano in action for Catalans Dragons

results.description: Louis Senior scores four tries as Huddersfield beat Catalans Dragons to secure their Super League status.
results.shortTitle: Giants win to secure Super League status
results.title: Super League: Huddersfield Giants 24-22 Catalans Dragons - hosts win to secure top-flight status

results.description: Tony Gigot, Kenny Edwards and Jodie Broughton, who is to join Championship side Halifax, are all to leave the Super League club.
results.shortTitle: Gigot, Edwards & Broughton exit Catalans
results.title: Catalans Dragons: Tony Gigot, Kenny Edwards & Jodie Broughton to leave Perpignan

thumbnail.altText: Kenny Edwards (left), Jodie Broughton and Tony Gigot

results.description: London Broncos lose at Wakefield and are relegated from Super League - relive the action from Friday's five games.
results.shortTitle: London relegated from Super League - the action as it happened
results.title: Super League live: London Broncos relegated - the action as it happened

results.description: Wigan move to within a point of a second-place finish as Bevan French's treble helps them cruise past Catalans.
results.shortTitle: French shines as Wigan rout Catalans
results.title: Super League: Bevan French stars as Wigan beat Catalans 46-12

thumbnail.altText: Bevan French scored the first three Wigan tries and was involved in three more

results.description: Friday's action in the Super League - listen to BBC Radio commentary.
results.shortTitle: Listen: Friday's Super League commentaries
results.title: Listen to live Super League commentaries

results.description: Tony Smith's Hull KR give their Super League survival hopes a massive lift with a 24-6 victory at Catalans Dragons.
results.shortTitle: Rovers win in Perpignan to boost hopes
results.title: Super League: Hull Kingston Rovers beat Catalans Dragons 24-6 to give survival hopes a lift

results.description: Catalans Dragons host Hull KR in Super League - listen to BBC Radio Humberside commentary.
results.shortTitle: Listen: Catalans Dragons v Hull KR
results.title: Listen to Catalans Dragons v Hull KR commentary

results.description: Hooker Alrix Da Costa signs a new contract to keep him at the Stade Gilbert Brutus until 2021.
results.shortTitle: Da Costa signs new deal with Catalans
results.title: Alrix Da Costa: Catalans Dragons hooker signs new two-year contract

results.description: Super League bottom club London Broncos further spice up the relegation battle by damaging Catalans Dragons' top-five bid.
results.shortTitle: Broncos upset Catalans in Perpignan
results.title: Super League: Bottom club London Broncos win 17-4 to upset Catalans

thumbnail.altText: Only four players have scored more points in Super League this season than Kieran Dixon, who ended with a 10-point individual haul
